duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct comprehensive assessments such as ESDM, VB-MAPP, PEAK, AFLS, and various assessment tools.
Develop personalized treatment plans and behavior support strategies tailored to individual needs.
Train, guide, and oversee Behavior Technicians and Registered Behavior Technicians.
Deliver parent training sessions utilizing Behavior Skills Training.
Implement Crisis Management procedures as necessary.
Uphold strict confidentiality standards and adhere to the ethical guidelines outlined in the BACB Ethics Code.
Demonstrate exemplar leadership qualities by modeling professional behaviors within the clinic environment.

education_certification.credential: Master’s Degree in Applied Behavior Analysis or related field
BCBA Certification and maintain good standing with the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB)
Experience in offering supervision to Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs)
Exceptional written and verbal communication aptitude
Background supervising Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) programs
